Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice or Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; added white outline of lotus bud above two white bands; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic elements and the absence of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces make it impossible to determine whether it came from a kantharos or a chalice. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) have very little decoration as well. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two white bands (Williams 1983, 169).
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 20.22)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1485) (phase 2)
